question_sentence: Millions of people in the US are under air quality alerts this week. What is causing a thick haze drifting across the Northeast, Midwest and Mid-Atlantic?
evidence: Millions of people remain at risk of inhaling potentially harmful air as wildfire smoke originating from Canada shrouds major US cities.

question_sentence: Residents in Washington, DC, were startled by a loud sound this week. What caused the boom heard throughout the capital city?
evidence: Military jets were “authorized to travel at supersonic speeds” as they raced to make contact with an unresponsive aircraft flying in the region that later crashed in a heavily wooded area. The extraordinary speed of the jets caused a sonic boom across the Washington, DC, area that confused many residents.

question_sentence: Apple recently unveiled its most ambitious – and riskiest – new product in years. What is it called?
evidence: Apple introduced a “mixed reality” headset called Apple Vision Pro, a technology that overlays virtual images on live video of the real world. The company said it will be available early next year in the US.

question_sentence: Which country’s outdated rail network was criticized this week in the wake of a devastating train accident?
evidence: A deadly train crash in India has renewed calls for authorities to confront safety issues in a railway system that transports more than 13 million passengers every day.

question_sentence: While many US industries have recovered from the Covid-19 pandemic, which major sector still has a huge shortage of workers?
evidence: The leisure and hospitality industry is struggling to recover all the workers it lost due to the pandemic, recent data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics shows. This sector has the biggest shortage of workers, down 349,000 people, or 2% of the total pre-pandemic workforce.

question_sentence: Which NFL team made a visit to the White House this week to celebrate their Super Bowl victory?
evidence: President Joe Biden welcomed the Super Bowl Champion Kansas City Chiefs to the White House Monday. See photos from the special occasion.

question_sentence: NASA will launch a spacecraft to an unexplored metal world this fall. What is the mission called?
evidence: The uncrewed endeavor, known as the Psyche mission, will send the first NASA spacecraft designed to study a metallic asteroid. It is set to launch in October, NASA said.

question_sentence: Which fruit crop in Georgia has been severely impacted by extreme winter weather?
evidence: The Peach State lost 90% of its staple fruit crop this year after abnormally warm winter weather and a late-season freeze, researchers say.

question_sentence: Which automaker recalled around 125,000 SUVs and trucks this week?
evidence: Ford appears to be facing more manufacturing problems. See the models affected by the latest recall.

question_sentence: Starbucks expanded its menu in several states this week to offer drinks made with which controversial ingredient?
evidence: Despite somewhat negative reviews, Starbucks is bringing its controversial olive oil coffee to more cities.

question_sentence: Chris Licht, the embattled CEO of which company stepped down this week?
In protest of the debt limit deal, a group of right-wing House Republicans tanked a vote on GOP-backed legislation addressing:
Which two sports entities announced a stunning merger this week?
McDonald’s announced a birthday meal, available beginning June 12, for which character?
Soccer icon Lionel Messi announced this week where he'll play next. Which league does he plan on joining?
In a two-year study, what dangerous sea creatures were observed by researchers swimming safely in very close proximity to humans?
Prince Harry took the stand in a London courtroom this week as part of his lawsuit accusing a British tabloid group of what?
In Ticketmaster's latest presale fiasco, fans of what comedian experienced problems, long waits and inflated prices?
Rose Zhang won the Mizuho Americas Open on Sunday, becoming the first golfer to win on the LPGA tour in her debut since:
One of the world's most active volcanoes began erupting this week on Hawaii's Big Island. What is the volcano called?
How many people will get a universal basic income (UBI) of £1,600 a month in a proposed trial in England?
evidence: If the two-year pilot programme secures funding, volunteers to receive UBI will be selected at random from Jarrow in South Tyneside and East Finchley in north London, and 20% of places will be reserved for people with disabilities.

question_sentence: What is the name of Apple’s newly unveiled “mixed reality” headset?
evidence: Touted as the “most advanced personal electronic device ever”, the $3,499 (£2,800) headset blends digital content with the physical world.

question_sentence: Data shows that which infectious disease is overtaking Covid-19 as the world’s most deadly?
evidence: Experts fear that TB represents a “ticking timebomb”, amid soaring infection and death rates. Latest figures suggest that the disease killed around 4,400 people a day worldwide in 2021.

question_sentence: Colombia’s authorities are being urged to act against a growing population of which animal?
evidence: The so-called “cocaine hippos” are descendants of four brought to Colombia by late druglord Pablo Escobar. Warnings that they pose a serious threat to humans and other wildlife have intensified after a new census found that the invasive hippo population has expanded to up to 215.

question_sentence: Man City’s 2-1 victory over Man Utd last weekend brought the Sky Blue’s total tally of FA Cup title wins to how many?
evidence: The latest victory puts Man City joint with Aston Villa for total FA Cup title wins. The record for the most wins is held be Arsenal, at 14, followed by Man Utd (12), and Chelsea, Liverpool and Tottenham (all on 8).

question_sentence: Around 5,000 people took part in a record-breaking “Grande Dictée” (Great Dictation) event at which landmark Paris location?
evidence: Thousands of desks were set up along the iconic avenue before participants took part in a series of spelling bees on Sunday. For more odd and unexpected news, sign up to the Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: What is the average cost of attending a hen or stag party in the UK, according to a survey for Aviva?
evidence: The research found that men spent £920 on average for celebrations in the UK, while women typically paid £652. For a stag or hen do abroad, men spent an average of £1,256, while women forked out £1,158.

question_sentence: New research suggests that heart attacks are most likely to happen on what day?
evidence: An analysis of data on 10,528 patients admitted to hospital in Ireland with a serious heart attack over a five-year period found that rates were 13% higher on Mondays. Possible reasons suggested include disruptions to sleep cycles over the weekend that may trigger higher levels of inflammation and stress hormones when people return to their usual weekday rising times.

question_sentence: Which supermarket has been named Britain’s cheapest for a 12th consecutive month?
evidence: Latest research by Which? found that Aldi has remained the cheapest supermarket since May 2022, with an average basket of goods costing £68.60 last month. Lidl was just behind at £70.51, while Waitrose was the most expensive, at £86.91.

question_sentence: Italy’s Supreme Court has ordered a city council in Lombardy to pay a couple €50,000 (£43,000) for failing to safeguard them against what?
evidence: The landmark ruling concludes a 10-year legal case in which the couple sought the right to “a quiet life” and “rest” at their home in Carmine, a district with bustling nightlife in the northern city of Brescia.
